alert.note: Alert for Coos; Douglas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 4:45PM PST until January 04 at 5:23PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oregon, including the following areas, Coos and Douglas. * WHEN...Until 345 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Landslide was reported on Highway 38 east of Elkton. Additional landslides are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM PST, Trained weather spotters reported flooding in Low lying areas near Brummit Creek. This is causing small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Low lying areas near Brummit Creek are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.8 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winston, Umpqua, Tyree Campground, Eagleview Campground, Camas Valley, Loon Lake, Scottsburg, Elkton and Sitkum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
